I am not coming because the weather is so bad.

text: He isn’t coming because he isn’t invited.

text: I am not coming because I have no time.

text: I am not staying because I still have to work.
translate: Ma ei jää, sest pean veel töötama.

text: I’m going because it is already late.

text: I didn’t come because I was ill.

text: She didn’t come because she was tired.

text: He didn’t come because he wasn’t interested.
translate: Ta ei tulnud, sest tal ei olnud tuju.

text: We didn’t come because our car is damaged.

text: They didn’t come because they missed the train.

text: I didn’t come because I was not allowed to.

Kas te saaksite need pildid ilmutada?

text: The pictures are on the CD.

translate: Kas te saaksite seda kella parandada?

text: Can you clean the pants / trousers?

text: He is staying in a hotel.
He is staying in a cheap hotel.
He is reading a boring novel.
She is watching an exciting movie.
70 years ago he was still young.

text: A woman who weighs a hundred kilos is fat.
A man who weighs fifty kilos is thin.
Why aren’t you eating the cake?
I’m not eating it because I must lose weight.
translate: Ma ei söö seda, sest ma pean alla võtma.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the beer?
I’m not drinking it because I have to drive.
translate: Ma ei joo seda, sest pean veel sõitma.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the coffee?
I’m not drinking it because it is cold.
translate: Ma ei joo seda, sest see on külm.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the tea?
I’m not drinking it because I don’t have any sugar.
translate: Ma ei joo seda, sest mul ei ole suhkrut.

text: Why aren’t you eating the soup?
I’m not eating it because I didn’t order it.
translate: Ma ei söö seda, sest ma ei ole seda tellinud.

text: Why don’t you eat the meat?
I’m not eating it because I am a vegetarian.

text: How did you pass the exam?
How did you find the way?
With whom did you make an appointment?
With whom did you celebrate your birthday?
What did you come to know?
Which newspaper did you subscribe to?
Why did you become a teacher?
Why did you take a taxi?
I was talking on the phone all the time.

text: My son did not want to play with the doll.
translate: Mu poeg ei tahtnud nukkudega mängida.

text: My daughter did not want to play football / soccer (am.).
translate: Mu tütar ei tahtnud jalgpalli mängida.

text: My wife did not want to play chess with me.
translate: Mu naine ei tahtnud minuga malet mängida.

text: My children did not want to go for a walk.
translate: Mu lapsed ei tahtnud jalutuskäigule minna.

text: They did not want to tidy the room.
They did not want to go to bed.
He was not allowed to eat ice cream.
He was not allowed to eat chocolate.
He was not allowed to eat sweets.
I was allowed to make a wish.
I was allowed to buy myself a dress.
I was allowed to take a chocolate.
Were you allowed to smoke in the airplane?
Were you allowed to drink beer in the hospital?
Were you allowed to take the dog into the hotel?

text: During the holidays the children were allowed to remain outside late.
translate: Vaheajal tohivad lapsed kauem väljas olla.

text: They were allowed to play in the yard for a long time.
They were allowed to stay up late.
Did you have to call an ambulance?
Did you have to call the doctor?
Did you have to call the police?
Do you have the telephone number? I had it just now.

text: Do you have the address? I had it just now.
translate: Kas teil on see aadress? Hetk tagasi oli mul see veel.

text: Do you have the city map? I had it just now.

text: Did he come on time? He could not come on time.
translate: Tuli ta täpselt? Ta ei saanud täpselt tulla.

text: Did he find the way? He could not find the way.
translate: Leidis ta tee? Ta ei leidnud teed.

text: Did he understand you? He could not understand me.
translate: Sai ta sinust aru? Ta ei saanud minust aru.

text: Why could you not come on time?
translate: Miks ei saanud sa täpselt tulla?

text: Why could you not find the way?
Why could you not understand him?

text: I could not come on time because there were no buses.
translate: Ma ei saanud täpselt jõuda kuna ühtegi bussi ei läinud.

text: I could not find the way because I had no city map.

text: I could not understand him because the music was so loud.

text: I had to take a taxi.
I had to buy a city map.
I had to switch off the radio.
I’m angry that you drink so much beer.

text: I’m angry that you come so late.
translate: Mind ärritab, et sa nii hilja tuled.

text: I think he needs a doctor.
translate: Ma arvan, et tal on arsti vaja.
Ma arvan, et ta on haige.

text: I think he is sleeping now.
translate: Ma arvan, et ta nüüd magab.

text: We hope that he marries our daughter.
translate: Me loodame, et ta abiellub meie tütrega.

text: We hope that he has a lot of money.
translate: Me loodame, et tal on palju raha.

text: We hope that he is a millionaire.
translate: Me loodame, et ta on miljonär.

text: I heard that your wife had an accident.
translate: Ma kuulsin, et su naisega juhtus õnnetus.

text: I heard that she is in the hospital.
translate: Ma kuulsin, et ta lamab haiglas.

text: I heard that your car is completely wrecked.
translate: Ma kuulsin, et su auto on täiesti katki.

text: I’m happy that you are interested.
translate: Mind rõõmustab, et te huvitatud olete.

text: I’m happy that you want to buy the house.

text: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.
translate: Ma kardan, et viimane buss on juba läinud.

text: I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.
translate: Ma kardan, et me peame takso võtma.

text: I’m afraid I have no more money.
translate: Ma kardan, et mul ei ole raha kaasas.

text: Perhaps the weather will get better tomorrow.
I hope that it gets better.
translate: Ma loodan, et see läheb paremaks.

text: Do you know that for sure?
I think that it is old.
translate: Ma pakun, et see on vana.
Ma arvan, et ta näeb lausa väga hea välja.

text: The boss definitely has a girlfriend.
It is very possible that he has a girlfriend.
translate: See on päris tõenäoline, et tal on tüdruksõber.

text: She took a piece of chocolate.
He was disloyal, but she was loyal.
translate: Ta oli truu, kuid tema oli truudusetu.

text: He was lazy, but she was hard-working.
translate: Ta oli laisk, kuid tema oli usin.

text: He was poor, but she was rich.
translate: Ta oli vaene, kuid tema oli rikas.

text: He had no money, only debts.
translate: Tal ei olnud raha vaid võlad.

text: He had no luck, only bad luck.

text: He had no success, only failure.
translate: Tal ei olnud edu vaid äpardumisi.

text: He was not satisfied, but dissatisfied.
translate: Ta ei olnud rahul vaid rahulolematu.

text: He was not happy, but sad.

text: He was not friendly, but unfriendly.

text: I’ll wait until my hair is dry.

text: I’ll wait until the film is over.

text: I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.

text: When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
Repair the roof before the winter begins.

text: Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
translate: Pese oma käed enne, kui lauda istud.

text: Close the window before you go out.
translate: Sulge aken enne, kui välja lähed.

text: Yes, after the class is over.
After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.
translate: Peale seda, kui tal õnnetus oli, ei saanud ta enam töötada.

text: After he had lost his job, he went to America.

text: After he went to America, he became rich.
translate: Peale seda, kui ta Ameerikasse läks, sai ta rikkaks.

text: You are so lazy – don’t be so lazy!
translate: Sa oled nii laisk – ära ole nii laisk!

text: You sleep for so long – don’t sleep so late!
translate: Sa magad nii kaua – ära maga nii kaua!

text: You come home so late – don’t come home so late!
translate: Sa tuled nii hilja – ära tule nii hilja!

text: You laugh so loudly – don’t laugh so loudly!
translate: Sa naerad nii valjusti – ära naera nii valjusti!

text: You speak so softly – don’t speak so softly!
translate: Sa räägid liiga vaikselt – ära räägi nii vaikselt!

text: You drink too much – don’t drink so much!
translate: Sa jood liiga palju – ära joo nii palju!

text: You smoke too much – don’t smoke so much!
translate: Sa suitsetad liiga palju – ära suitseta nii palju!

text: You work too much – don’t work so much!
translate: Sa töötad liiga palju – ära tööta nii palju!

text: You drive too fast – don’t drive so fast!
translate: Sa sõidad liiga kiiresti – ära sõida nii kiiresti!

text: We had to water the flowers.
We had to clean the apartment.
We had to wash the dishes.
Did you have to pay the bill?
Did you have to pay an entrance fee?
Did you have to pay a fine?

We did not want to drink anything.
We did not want to disturb you.
I just wanted to make a call.
I just wanted to call a taxi.
Actually I wanted to drive home.

text: I thought you wanted to call information.
translate: Ma mõtlesin, et sa tahtsid infonumbrile helistada.

text: I thought you wanted to order a pizza.
translate: Ma mõtlesin, et sa tahtsid pitsat tellida.

text: Since when is she no longer working?
translate: Mis ajast ta enam ei tööta?

text: Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
translate: Jah, ta ei tööta enam sellest ajast kui abiellus.

text: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
translate: Sellest ajast kui ta abiellus, ei tööta ta enam.

text: Since they have met each other, they are happy.
translate: Sellest ajast kui nad üksteist tunnevad, on nad õnnelikud.

text: Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
translate: Sellest ajast kui neil lapsed on, käivad nad harva väljas.
Jah, samal ajal kui ta autoga sõidab.
Ta helistab samal ajal kui ta autoga sõidab.

text: She watches TV while she irons.
translate: Ta vaatab telekat samal ajal kui triigib.

text: She listens to music while she does her work.
translate: Ta kuulab muusikat samal ajal kui oma ülesandeid täidab.

text: I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
translate: Ma ei näe midagi, kui mul prille ei ole.

text: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
translate: Ma ei saa millestki aru, kui muusika on nii vali.

text: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
translate: Ma ei tunne midagi, kui mul on nohu.

text: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
translate: Me võtame takso, kui vihma sajab.

text: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
translate: Me reisime ümber maailma, kui lotoga võidame.

text: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
translate: Me alustame söömisega, kui ta varsti ei tule.

text: Have you already been to Berlin?
translate: Olete te juba kunagi Berliinis olnud?

text: No, I don’t know anyone here.
translate: Ei, ma ei tunne siin mitte kedagi.

text: a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?
No, I won’t stay here much longer.
translate: Ei, ma ei jää enam kauaks siia.

text: Would you like to drink something else?
No, I don’t want anything else.
translate: Ei, ma ei soovi enam midagi.

text: No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.
translate: Ei, ma ei ole veel midagi söönud.

text: Does anyone else want a coffee?
The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.
translate: Reis oli tõesti ilus, kuid liialt koormav.

text: The train was on time, but too full.
translate: Rong oli tõesti täpne, kuid liialt täis.

text: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.
translate: Hotell oli tõesti mugav, kuid liialt kallis.

text: He’ll take either the bus or the train.
translate: Ta tuleb kas bussi või rongiga.

text: He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.
translate: Ta tuleb kas täna õhtul või homme varahommikul.

text: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.
translate: Ta elab kas meil või hotellis.

text: She speaks Spanish as well as English.
translate: Ta räägib nii hispaania kui inglise keelt.

text: She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.
translate: Ta on elanud nii Madridis kui Londonis.

text: She knows Spain as well as England.
translate: Ta tunneb nii Hispaaniat kui Inglismaad.

text: He is not only stupid, but also lazy.
translate: Ta ei ole mitte ainult rumal vaid ka laisk.

text: She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.
translate: Ta ei ole ainuüksi ilus vaid ka intelligentne.

text: She speaks not only German, but also French.
translate: Ta ei räägi ainult saksa vaid ka prantsuse keelt.

text: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
translate: Ma ei oska mängida ei klaverit ega kitarri.

text: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
translate: Ma ei oska tantsida ei valssi ega sambat.

text: I like neither opera nor ballet.
translate: Mulle ei meeldi ei ooper ega ballett.

text: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
translate: Mida kiiremini sa töötad, seda varem saad valmis.

text: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
translate: Mida varem sa tuled, seda varem saad ka minna.

text: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
translate: Mida vanemaks jäädakse, seda mugavamaks minnakse.

text: He fell asleep although the TV was on.
translate: Ta jäi magama, kuigi telekas töötas.

text: He stayed a while although it was late.
translate: Ta jäi veel, kuigi juba oli hilja.

text: He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.
translate: Ta ei tulnud, kuigi me leppisime kohtumise kokku.

text: The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.
translate: Telekas töötas. Sellele vaatamata jäi ta magama.

text: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.
translate: Oli juba hilja. Sellele vaatamata jäi ta veel.

text: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.
translate: Me leppisime kohtumise kokku. Sellele vaatamata ta ei tulnud.

text: Although he has no license, he drives the car.
translate: Ehkki tal ei ole juhiluba, sõidab ta autoga.

text: Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.
translate: Ehkki tänav on libe, sõidab ta kiiresti.

text: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.
translate: Ehkki ta on purjus, sõidab ta rattaga.

text: Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.
translate: Tal ei ole juhiluba. Sellele vaatamata sõidab ta autoga.

text: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.
translate: Tänav on libe. Sellele vaatamata sõidab ta nii kiiresti.

text: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.
translate: Ta on purjus. Sellele vaatamata sõidab ta rattaga.

text: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.
translate: Ta ei leia töökohta, kuigi ta on õppinud.

text: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Ta ei lähe arsti juurde, kuigi tal on valud.

text: Although she has no money, she buys a car.
translate: Ta ostab auto, kuigi tal ei ole raha.

text: She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.
translate: Ta on õppinud. Sellele vaatamata ei leia ta töökohta.

text: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Tal on valud. Sellele vaatamata ei lähe ta arsti juurde.

text: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.
translate: Tal ei ole raha. Sellele vaatamata ostab ta auto.

text: The button from the shirt is gone.
The boss’ computer is not working.
How do I get to her parents’ house?
translate: Kuidas saan ma tema vanemate maja juurde?

text: The house is at the end of the road.
What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
What are the doctor’s consultation times?
What time is the museum open?
I know that – I knew that.
translate: Ma tean seda – ma teadsin seda.

text: I write that – I wrote that.
translate: Ma kirjutan seda – ma kirjutasin seda.

text: I hear that – I heard that.
translate: Ma kuulan seda – ma kuulsin seda.

text: I’ll get it – I got it.
translate: Ma toon selle ära – ma tõin selle ära.

text: I’ll bring that – I brought that.
translate: Ma toon selle – ma tõin selle.

text: I’ll buy that – I bought that.
translate: Ma ostan selle – ma ostsin selle.

text: I expect that – I expected that.
translate: Ma ootan seda – ma ootasin seda.

text: I’ll explain that – I explained that.
translate: Ma seletan seda – ma seletasin seda.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: Ma tunnen seda – ma tundsin seda.

text: I don’t know if he loves me.
translate: Ma ei tea, kas ta armastab mind.

text: I don’t know if he’ll come back.
translate: Ma ei tea, kas ta tuleb tagasi.

text: I don’t know if he’ll call me.
translate: Ma ei tea, kas ta helistab mulle.

text: I wonder if he thinks about me.
translate: Ma küsin endalt, kas ta mõtleb minule.

text: I wonder if he has someone else.
translate: Ma küsin endalt, kas tal on keegi teine.
Ma küsin endalt, kas ta valetab.
Kas tal on tõesti keegi teine?

text: Maybe he tells me the truth?
I doubt whether he really likes me.
translate: Ma kahtlen, kas ma talle tegelikult meeldin.

text: I doubt whether he’ll write to me.
translate: Ma kahtlen, kas ta kirjutab mulle.

text: I doubt whether he’ll marry me.
translate: Ma kahtlen, kas ta minuga abiellub.

text: I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
translate: Ma tõusen üles kohe kui äratuskell heliseb.

text: I become tired as soon as I have to study.
translate: Ma olen väsinud kohe kui õppima pean.

text: I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
translate: Ma lõpetan töötamise kohe kui 60 saan.

text: As soon as I have a moment.
translate: Kohe kui mul on hetk aega.

text: He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
translate: Ta helistab kohe kui tal on hetk aega.

text: I’ll work as long as I can.
translate: Ma töötan nii kaua, kuni saan.

text: I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
translate: Ma töötan nii kaua, kuni olen terve.

text: He lies in bed instead of working.
translate: Ta lamab voodis selle asemel, et töötada.

text: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
translate: Ta loeb ajalehte selle asemel, et süüa teha.

text: He is at the bar instead of going home.
translate: Ta istub pubis selle asemel, et koju minna.

text: As far as I know, he lives here.
translate: Nii palju kui mina tean, elab ta siin.

text: As far as I know, his wife is ill.
translate: Nii palju kui mina tean, on ta naine haige.

text: As far as I know, he is unemployed.
translate: Nii palju kui mina tean, on ta töötu.

text: I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Ma magasin sisse, muidu oleksin täpselt jõudnud.

text: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Ma jäin bussist maha, muidu oleksin täpselt jõudnud.

text: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Ma ei leidnud teed, muidu oleksin täpselt jõudnud.
